Description: The temptation of Saint Antony [second version]; the saint is dragged by demons on the right; nude female figure on a carriage made of bones on the left; large winged creature vomiting demons on the upper part; rocky landscape with buildings on fire and monstrous creatures; coat of arms at the bottom. 1635 Etching
Curator's comments: A related drawing also from the Scarisbrick collection is in the BM, 1861,0713.6.
Bibliographic references: Meaume 1860 / Recherches sur la vie et les ouvrages de Jacques Callot (139.II)
Exhibition history: 2014-15 Sept - Jan.London, BM Witches and Wicked Bodies
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Associated with: Louis Phelypeaux de La Vrillière
Acquisition notes: From the Scarisbrick collection of Callot's work: see comment on 1861,0713.1.
